values:
LOOK WHO REFOUND HER LIVEJOURNAL

AYYYYYYYY

ahem

yup that happened
This journal is mostly closed and is used primarily for hunting down fics, icons, scans, etc.

There is nothing more amusing than discovering a new series, googling it, and having Google churn up a link titled, "[Spoilers] Baccano! - DotA Allstars Discussion".

If you don't understand why, click this link now and turn on a subwoofer.

That being said, I am mildly depressed that, once again, I have fallen madly in love with a series that has a smaller fanbase, despite being ridiculously awesome.

Granted, half the time you can't tell who's who, what's going on, or when exactly all this shit is going down, as there are massive time jumps that only really make sense about five episodes in, but it's worth it. Completely.

My favorite characters would be Vino [read: the psycho] and Czes [read: the shota], and I'm not entirely sure why, as I'm rather taken with Firo's hat as well but can't seem to like the rest of him. =/

Erin, your favorite character will either be Luck or Maiza. Possibly Jaccuzi, though he has the potential to annoy the hell out of you as well. Grant will like Ladd, if only because they seem to have the same love for violence and perpetual speech.

That is all. </bows>

HAPPY DAMN NEW YEAR.

...Or something.

I HAVE A COMPUTER.

...I have two, actually, because apparently I am not getting presents for Christmas next year-- my present will be college.

Two of which I've been accepted to, hooray!

...

Heather is sleepy.

DEARLORDGRAMMYISVISITING.

... DX

On an unrelated, yet even more tragic note-- I CANNOT FIND A COMPUTER I LIKE.

As I said, weeks ago, my computer, my laptop, my BABY-- died. Completely. And since then, I've been trying to locate a new, shiny laptop to replace my dead-and-buried laptop. And since then, I have been to Best Buy, CostCo, Circut City...

HP decided their computers needed more shiny, but in a bad way. They went chrome-tastic, and it is all kinds of hideous.

Basically, I need a laptop with a damn good graphics card, at least three USB ports, and a comfy built-in mouse. No annoying number keypad nonsense. Preferably not hideous. Even more preferably functional.

I'm already sobbing over the fact that it pretty much has to come with Vista.

Help!

Summary of the last two days of Forensics:

Heather-is-the-narrator-and-pwns-you-all: I warn you, I have burnt people before during labs like this.
Gaurav-is-impossible-to-spell: I'm sure you'll do fine.
Heather-might-kill-herself-if-she-keeps-on-typing-like-this: Yeeeeeeah. Sure. I'll be fine. You, however, might be missing an arm or two by the end of this.

We go back to the lab, and along with two bottles of acid, a bottle of bleach, and a bottle of acetone, we've got only three watchglasses.

The last one, closest to acid no. 1, is mysteriously filled with something left over from the last lab group. So Gaurav decides to get rid of it-- by reaching for the watchglass and spilling the mysterious, possibly acidic liquid all over his hand.

We sit there for a moment, then turn the sink on, and wait for it to wash off. 

We laugh about it for a bit, because he's fine, so it wasn't acid, and pour the rest of the mystery liquid down the sink.

.....

The sink starts smoking.

Lolboat. 

I just kidnapped Miranda from Spanish. This is a triumph. I'm making a note here, huge success. =D

My computer died, btw.

It was tragic.

...And as such, I have not been on Facebook, Livejournal, Gaia, or anything else.

And so, an important service announcement:

I am still alive.

That is all.

...My computer crashed, in the middle of burning the DVD with the Anime Club Commericial-- and thus, had to be wiped.

Which means I lost the WHOLE. DAMN. THING.

And because Adobe sucks ass, Elements won't transfer back onto the computer from my old back up because of copyright nonsense. Julie returned her copy to her school. So I had no editting equipment to re-do the video with.

Windows Movie Maker does not take VOB files. Neither did the 5 other freeware edits I DL'd.

And to show how truely desperate I was; Mum's Mac wouldn't take it either.

...I just finished the damn thing.

Again.

It sucks.

I no longer care.
 

Everyone will just have to deal.

Perfect World International amuses me.

It's like WoW, only free.

...Shiny. =D

...

...I'm stalling from finishing my transcript packet and working on applications. DX

After Heroes tonight, I felt compelled to write too much in a comment on the Sylar comm: http://community.livejournal.com/heroes_sylar/602924.html?thread=4720428#t4720428

EVERY WORD IS TRUE.

I feel both proud and awkward about having written the longest response.

It... just would not stop writing itself.

In other news, I'm home sick. DX

Today is made up of general suckage.

Around 1 AM or so, I woke myself up from a very disturbing dream which involved an evil Batman, someone turning into a man-eating plant, and orange cats attempting to slather me in butter and eat me alive.

My subconscious is more fucked up than I thought.

After being shooed away from a disgruntled mother unit, I hung out on youtube until 3 AM or so in an attempt to rewire my brain onto something more pleasant than a demented batman and his experiments with hypnotizing cats.

I then decided to fuck it all and just try to sleep again already.

My next dream was better-- I can't remember much except for kayaking, Renji, pirates, and my horrible death by drowning at the end.

By the time I woke up from that, it was bright enough that I didn't even bother going back to sleep, and simply went to check on my Perfectworld account to see if they'd finally sent me a confirmation link so I could log on already. They hadn't. I promptly smacked my computer, and in retaliation, it decided to continue timing out all of my login sessions. Eventually I went and logged on via Mum's Mac-- and made an entirely new account using my verizon e-mail.

And ta-da, it worked. Apparently the retards at Perfectworld didn't feel it was important to mention that they don't send confirmation links out to Yahoo accounts. So, all of the waiting I've put in since Friday was completely useless to begin with.

God.

So now I can log in, supposedly-- though it only works on their site when I'm using the Mac --and play the game. Except the patch update program keeps timing out.

And to make things even more peachy, I've got a Film Fest Meeting tonight.

School hasn't even fucking started. 

I don't do social shit. 

I do unnecessary and pointless planning shit even less.

Fuck. Everything.

Bleach is back on my happy fandom list. That being said-- Hichi/Ichi friends only banner. =D



Image snagged from the doujin Monochrome. Small banner is small.  





._.; Ah, my poor distorted journal.

Today is my birthday.

This is sorta a big deal, but will not be treated as such, because my birthdays always have low attendance. Summer birthdays FAIL. Most notably the August-type ones, because that's also known as 'Last-minute-vacation-time!'. And despite the brilliant fact that it's the thirteenth of the month and that makes it special in all sorts of cool ways, no one really thinks that's all that impressive.

</emo>

On a happy, cake-related note, there will be cake.

Not a lie. =D

I'm pretty much counting this year by facebook comments. 

I mean, I never actually talk to most of my friends on facebook, but damn it all if I won't be checking who's bothered to glance at that birthday box on the homepage. 

I don't really do parties. Okay, I do other people's parties, but I don't bother with mine anymore. 

My last real attempt for a proper birthday was met with complete and utter failure, but somehow ended up being one of the happiest days of my life. 

I had exactly one attendee despite all the invites I had sent out, and that was Julie. My Mum hung out with us as we did the usual birthday classics like cake and jewelry-making. Dad skipped over the necklaces but stayed for the cake. At some point, while being squished on a couch that really could have fit a good five people on it comfortably if we'd bothered to place the one seat back, we ended up watching Elizabethtown, because Orlando Bloom was exceptionally drool-worthy.

And at some point while watching the movie, I ended up crying because I was so goddamn happy to have these wonderful people trying to make this my best fucking birthday, attendance be damned. 

I mean, I don't really know how, but for all the times I feel like I have absolutely no reason to even be here and screw up in the worst possible wau, I've still got people who love me at the end of the day.

I've got people to come 'home' to. And that's the best present anyone could ever give me.

So for my birthday, I just kinda want to be with the people who are really important to me, the people who've supported me through my most idiotic moments and have always managed to be there even if I can't get a damn hug in person-- and make sure to give me plenty when we're together for when we're apart.

All of my love to Julie (
lifebeforetaxes
 ) and Erin (
hatazo
 ). You both know I'd be severely fucked up or dead without you guys, so... thanks. For everything.

I love you both so damn much.

And that's enough sap for now.

I killed a tire on my first driving lesson.

Way to go, jackass.

In photoshop/picture-related news, I came up with my next LJ layout. The only problem is, I kinda like what I have now. Or rather, I'd rather not have to change it all back really soon because I want bright colours.

It's kinda inspired by Regina Spektor's song Music Box. The first part of the lyrics have been mildly imprinted in my mind by a KH fanfic, and I woke up yesterday with them dancing through my head. The middle part of the song drives me insane, because I think that it probably could have been less random and much more meaningful.

</pauses to munch on a peach> X3 The only good thing about summer is fresh fruit.

But yeah. I might change my layout. DX Again. 

Preview:


Once again, the art is completely and totally not mine. I can't draw Al's armor. XD At all. I just colour parts of Idea's doujins.

On another happy note, I'm officially getting all the diskspace I need-- for free. Originally I was planning to get a harddrive this year with my birthday cash, but after informing Mum that I had no more space on my external drive and therefore could not download Bleach, she suddenly had the urge to go shopping. 

Which means I'm going to go for a tablet this year, and I'll actually get to colour some of my own art for once.

This is kind of a big deal. 

Yay. <3

H'okay. 

So I've gotten my pictures from Metrocon 2008 up-- on my deviantart. 

GO SEE THEM. <3

I didn't actually take many, believe it or not. I suppose I was busy running around with Sam and making suggestive comments with Grant. These are the ones that actually turned out decent. I took about five of that one Renji, but only one didn't have people walking right in front of me. Fucking flugtag... -.-'

I'm also pasting this up on
fm_alchemist
, so if any of those random FMA cosplayers are looking for themselves, they don't have to dig too deep. =D

Title: Ends in Tears.
Author: Lilangelheather
Fandom: FullMetal Alchemist
Rating: PG-13
Genre: Humor
Word Count: 1061
Summary: In which Ed complains about his lack of luck with... Well, anyone, really. And all Al wanted was to finish his book.

Warnings: References both yaoi and het pairings of all shapes and sizes. Spoilers for end of series and movie! Contains a massive amount of whiny!Ed. 

 

"Goddamnit!" Edward Elric yelled, slamming his fist hard against the desk in front of him. The computer monitor happily displaying 'Livejournal' in front of him leapt. He glared down at the wood beneath his automail for a solid minute before whipping his head around to glare at his brother, sitting a good six feet away on the bed, reading a book. "Why does everything end in tears?!"

Alphonse Elric sighed and turned a page. "We live happily ever after, brother."

The blonde pushed his chair around to face his younger sibling, wincing at the harsh scraping sound the chair made against the floor. "World War II, Al. Incest, Al. Gay, Al. That's what everyone agrees on in fandom. How do you see that as a 'happily ever after', huh?!"

"I had grandkids in that OVA."

"And I was living alone at age one-fucking-hundred! How am I happy?"

Al frowned at this and had to reread the line he was on. "Oh. It's all about you then, brother. You weren't specific enough the first time."

"God," Ed cried out to a deity he still adamantly refused to believe in. "You suck."

There was silence for a moment as Ed glared at the ceiling.

"Who was it this time?" Al asked, glancing up from his book in time to see his brother flick off the heavens.

"Heiderich. Again."

"Well, canonically, he was ill. And he did die. There's pretty much nothing you can do to save that, if it's canon." Alphonse could almost swear he could hear Ed's teeth grinding over on the other side of the room.

"That's not the point, Al. All of my relationships end in complete and dismal failure."

"At least you have them. It's hard to have sex when you're a tin can."

Ed frowned over at him. "You got a body in the movie."

"I was reborn as a pre-pubescent child, brother. If it was illegal for the Colonel to screw you as a minor when there was a fourteen year age gap, it's even more illegal to even consider it with me."

"That didn't stop him from trying," Ed groused.

"It was sort of flattering in a creepy you-screwed-my-brother-and-now-you-want-me?-you-pedo! sort of way," Al mused. He turned another page.

"I mean," Ed continued loudly, "even the Colonel and I get screwed over. Seriously! He looked like he and Riza were having a damn good time at the end of the series, and all the sudden, WHAM! He's out in pseudo-Russia angsting over me. He finally gets out of his funk and I have to leave to stop the world-- worlds --from collapsing in on themselves!"

"That sounds more like his problem, brother."

Ed waved his arm in an exasperated sort of way. "But it relates to me!"

"He was smiling when you left."

"...I bet you he ended up alone at one hundred, too. And then there's Winry! Look at what happened to her! She spent all that time waiting for me and I had to leave her, too!"

Al sighed.

"I'm serious, Al! And it's not just me, either! Hughes, Gracia, all the Homunculus, Greed's little gang, Mustang, Winry, Heiderich, Scar, Mom, Dad-- No one lives happily ever after! It is fucking impossible for anyone in this show to end up happy!"

"Alter!Hughes and Alter!Gracia seemed to be doing swell. They even attended the other Al's funeral together."

"If thats what Hughes considers a date, they won't be doing swell for long."

The younger Elric rolled his eyes. "Rose seemed happy with her daycare."

"...I've been wondering. She spends months as the figurehead for an armed religious rebellion, chased after by the military, and all the sudden people are like, 'Hey! Watch my kid for a day!' What's up with that, huh?"

"Where did that come from?"

"You mentioned the kids. But seriously, how does that make any sense?"

"Brother, does anything about our show make any sense?"

Ed twirled around and grudgingly went back to his computer. He stared at the screen and quite suddenly opened up Google and started typing. Al went on reading for a moment, before curiously glancing up at his brother. "What are you doing?"

"Online dating, Al. I'm gonna look through some personal ads. Maybe set one up for myself."

Al's eyebrows found their way into his hairline. "Excuse me?"

Ed waved a hand in the air idly. "Come on. You never know. Want me to set up one for you, too?"

"What?"

Ed glared back at his brother. "I want my happily ever after, damnit."

"And you're going to use the internet to find it? Come on, there's gotta be someone we haven't thought of!" Al racked his brain for a moment, finally tossing his book aside. "We haven't done all the Alternate Universe people yet. There's still Alter!Winry and Alter!Roy--"

"Not canon," Ed replied.

"Well, there's..." Al trailed off before pointing triumphantly at his brother. "Alter!Scar and Alter!Lust! They were together at the end, remember? In the wagon!"

Ed frowned, trying to remember the five second cameo the pair made. "...We don't know that they were actually together together. I mean, it wasn't actually Alter!Lust, right? It was the alternate version of the woman who became Lust in our world. And she had a thing for Scar's brother." He scrolled down some search results and squinted at the screen. "And anyway-- I'm still left alone."

"Brother," Al cried, exasperated. "Would it kill you to read a proper AU fic?"

"Yes," Ed replied stubbornly. "It would."

"But why?! If you don't count the High School and Crossover ones, most of them are actually pretty decent!"

Edward turned back around, glaring. "They always turn me into a whiny brat!"

"You ARE a whiny brat, brother!"

Ed twitched. "Am not!"

"Brother," Al replied, crossing his arms as he stood from his seat on the bed. Ed swiveled around in his chair, sulking. "Have you been present for any of this conversation? Because it completely contradicts that statement. And you're-- You're not listening to me, are you?" Alphonse sighed.

"Noa!" Ed shouted with a sudden grin, snapping out of his sulk. "She liked me, right? I mean, she's read my memories and shit, so she's seen how badass I am. She was with us at the end of the movie, too, so I bet we ended up together."

"There you go. Happy ending." Al shook his head and flopped back down onto the bed, rolling over and grabbing his book, opening it back to the page he had previously been reading.

"Al?"

"...What, brother?"

"I wouldn't be happy with Noa."

"And why not? She's nice."

"Well... I'm still gay."

Al groaned.

 

 

AN:

Oh, Ed. Never change.

Inspired by yet another EdHei fic, in which Hei dies. Again.

...

WHY?! WHY DO THEY ALL END IN TEARS?!




...Ah. I forgot to mention Izumi. I suppose she ends up happy with Wrath and all.

But still very, very dead, and thus, does not count.

H'okay.

Since it's early enough for me to not have done anything yet, we're going into recap mode.

Thursday, Mum and I decided to take pictures of the Stone Church, and ran around the graveyard there while we were at it. I've got 176 pictures and am very happy about that. Old buildings make me happy.

[ Gravestones, with the church in the background. ]
Bigger picture available on my deviantart.



So, yesterday I ran around Rutgers with Mum, who spent a great deal of time pointing at buildings and saying, "That's new", as if she was amazed that there were suddenly more buildings than thirty years ago. 

We're also rating New York-style pizza places while we're in NJ. Since the old pizza place by the firehouse switched owners, their pizza is kind of really bad. So we're looking for a replacement. My favorite so far is the one with the amazingly cute cook-- I never caught the name of the place, but we went twice, and it's near Caputo's, --followed by the place on campus, and then the Mona Lisa.

Mmmm, pizza.

This morning I was woken up by... Emma. Surprise, surprise. Apparently this morning was her first bath. She was not happy about it. 

That being said, her voice carries.

Hence, why I am posting at nine in the morning. DX 

I need a vacation away from my vacation.

I just watched Continuum. And I have one thing to say:

OHMYGODCRIPPLE!DANNYHOWILOVEYOUSO.

...That is all. </bows>

H'okay, so I'm in NJ, waiting for Kristine's baby to be born already.

Essentially, last night around six or so, Mum got a call from Kristine as she headed to the hospital, and Mum and I jumped in the car after a quick load of laundry. We ended up arriving at the hospital at one AM, and finally crashed at Kristine's house at three.

Now we're back, waiting for Emma to hurry up and be born.

...

Babies. DX 



EDIT: I'm an aunt as of 2:06 PM. <3

I'm tired, so I'll make this as succinct as possible:

I R HOME. YAY. 

SLEEPY TIEM NAO.

Con coverage, recap of Day 2. Note that there are now two people named Josh. The one previously referred to in my journal before Metrocon '08 is Josh the Awesome. The new one is Josh the Second.

[ Grant and I going for a happy-tastic Elric brothers glomp. ]



Day 2. 

Woke up at some ungodly hour and shrugged on half of my movie!Al cosplay before marching over to the second hotel room to meet up with the rest of our group, most of which was dressing up from One Piece, with Grant (as movie!Ed), Kenny (as a half-assed Viral from TTGL) and myself excepted. 

Watched as half the group took turns spray-dying each other's hair while brushing my wig out and making obscene jokes with anyone who wasn't rushing about. Finished minor costume details and we rushed out to the con. 

The one problem with movie!Al is that he is also known as cosplay!Al, AKA: the almost-but-not-quite-accurate Edward Elric, at least to the uneducated masses. Having Grant as movie!Ed helped a bit, but I was still confused as Ed more times than I can count, which is rather funny considering that my wig was most definately not blonde nor braided, but was practically identical in colour to Al's hair in the movie.

And you know how perfectionist I am, so you know I checked.

More than once.

I ran into several happy FMA people as well, and we marched around in a happy little group which usually consisted of myself, Grant, an Ed named Michael, another Ed of the female variety named Sam, a Winry named Emily, an unnamed Envy, and several military officers, most notably the cute Havoc and miniskirt!Sheska and miniskirt!Riza. 

Lots of Elricest occured, most of which I was at the center of, considering I was the only Al, and the Eds continued to multiply. 

Had several people spaz out about my eyes and how I wasn't wearing contacts, but actually have Al's eye colour. It was kind of funny, because I somehow get all shy and embarassed when people compliment me on stuff like that, and ended up acting more like Al. Squeeing insued.

We spent quite a lot of time sitting in the dealer's room, usually in one of the corners, with different groups of assorted people, as my feet hurt from my boots and Grant's shoes actually ended up breaking along the seam of both sides.

We had shoe issues. 

Yeah.

Apparently Red Bull was having a Flugtag, which happened to take place right outside the convention center, so we had to deal with several drunken idiots that simply would not take a hint and fuck off.

We planned to have a massive FMA meeting in room 13 during the FMA:CoS showing, but unfortunately the Whose Anime? panel was at the same time. It's kinda funny, remembering how it was originally, in a regular panel room where we actually had room for everyone to sit, and then the next year, where it was still in a normal panel room, but an overcrowded one where there was a line out the door and hardly any standing space. This year, they decided that a simple panel room would not be enough, and upgraded to a stage, complete with microphones and a catwalk. 

The signs also upgraded from "Break out into Massive Orgy" to "Break out into Global Orgy". 

Yaoi Man made his appearance again as well, and Stripper Man was introduced.

I ended up running back to the FMA:CoS showing just in time to see where Al met up with Ed via a suit of armor, and promptly glomped Grant the exact moment Al cried, "Brother!"

There was much rejoicing, and we spent the rest of the show laughing about how Alfons is totally gay for Ed, and how Al's little speech after stalking Ed crossing the gate sounded very similar to a proposal.

Something along the lines of 'staying by your side forever' and togetherness. Either way, we made quite a show of bowing at the end of the movie along with Emily, who changed from anime!Winry to movie!Winry just for the occasion, and Michael, our 12-year-old Ed that we happily corrupted with as much innuendo as we possibly could.

In the end, I spent most of my time pre-rave with Grant, where we clung to each other in a not-so-brotherly manner and had our very serious get-to-know-you-and-all-your-dark-secrets discussion, which was rather fun. 
 
You know, the serious questions like, 'What do you want to do with your life?', 'What do you think about God, death, and other cheerful nonsense?' and 'What's your favorite colour, anyway?'.

We both like red. Preferably dark, but saying 'blood red' is just too cliche, so we just say red.

We went off to the hotel after the movie and met up with the rest of the group, putting as many glowsticks on Grant that we could manage. ...We managed a lot. He could light up the entire hotel bathroom just by himself.

Managed free coffee down in the lobby. May or may not have had alcohol in it, either way it was passed around the room while we stuck glowsticks in Grant's hair while watching Pysch.

Unfortunately, the rave opened an hour and a half late, so we were kind of annoyed at that. We spent the time waiting in line while singing Disney and Voltaire songs.

Midway through I ended up ditching the boots, and was supremely happy when Josh the Second helped me limp back awkwardly to the hotel, as I killed some muscle in my foot that should not have been killed. 

The boys-- mostly Grant, our resident Pretty Pretty Princess and Radioactive Man, --pretty much stripped off their glowsticks the moment they got into their room, and the glow on the floor was epic enough for them to summon us to come see it. We pretty much ended up collapsed randomly around the room, pondering the ethics of not bothering to move back into our own rooms for the night. I happy snagged the pillow offered by Grant and ended up lying around on his bed with him, Josh the Awesome, and Krissy for another hour or so while listening to Josh the Second play the guitar. 

Megan ended up falling asleep next to Matt on the floor, and though they were quite possibly the cutest thing ever, we eventually had to drag her back to her own bed.

Sat up with Erin discussing raves and other dance-related things while eating ramen at five in the morning, then finally went to bed for the night. 


End Day 2.

So. This will be a pretty long post.

Or not. I may get lazy midway through.

Let's start with Friday:

[ Hello, Metrocon. ]



Day 1.

Went to bed at three in the morning, woke up an hour later to get into the car and drive to BWI. Dragged my luggage (and my very sleepy self) to the gate and dropped my bags down in a chair.

And then I hear someone calling my name, so I turn around and promptly think, "Terrorist."

Because lo and behold, Miranda and I had somehow magically found our way onto the same flight into Atlanta. After a few awkward ommisions from our usual greeting, we mixed up some seating arrangements with another passenger and settled somewhere around the proximity of seats 25 DEF, where we proceeded to do what we always do; make comments that are completely inappropriate in certain settings.

Like singing our remake of "I Believe in A Thing Called Love", more commonly known as "I Believe in A Thing Called Jihad", and telling stories about getting pulled over by police officers and having them call your house, which is labelled as "Jihad Headquarters" in your phone directory.

Stitched the corners of the flamel on my jacket back down with my mini, security-approved sewing kit-- the iron-on stuff just wasn't holding in places.

We also played with my smartphone and discovered that it actually cannot be turned off.

...Seriously.

We parted ways in Altanta and I boarded the plane to Sarasota, where I proceeded to sit with a woman who was having an absolutely dreadful day, and had spilled a considerable amount of coffee on her white shirt.

On a side note, the stewardess introduced us to the fine art of cleaning stains with only Seltzer water and a maxi pad.

Arrived at the Sarasota airport and promptly started stripping. Long sleeved coats are fine for freezing cold planes, not freakin' miserable hot weather of doom. The massive amount of black I was wearing did not help.

Ran into Erin and Ana, who drove me over to the store to buy Diet Coke and Chex Mix for our trip, and got changed in the car. Drove over to Josh's, picked him up, laughed at the eleven fuzzy hats he was wearing, and drove to Matt's.

Shoved everyone-- and all of our food, clothes, etc. --into Matt's father's car, and drove to Tampa.

Spent more time trying to stitch the corners of the flamel down, took several pictures of Josh sitting back in the trunk with the luggage, sleeping his ass off while the rest of us chatted away.

Learned a plethora of names of FL kids from the Anime Club at Erin's school, including, but not limited to Grant, Rutherford, Krissy, Kirsten, Ana, Kenny, Becca, Megan, Matt, Josh and the other Josh, because apparently we needed more pretty and Joshes seem to be good at that.

We had to wait until everyone arrived to pick up our Metrocon tickets, because this year registration was a bitch like that. So when we officially dressed-- With me as Hunni again, for the Ball, --and left the Hyatt, it was just past six in the afternoon. 

We pretty much took two steps into the dealer's room and they announced they were closing.

Picked up a stalker in the form of a femme!Hunni, who would not, for the life of me, leave me alone. My eventual escape was entirely a group effort, with special props to Kirsten, who attempted to hide me in the bathroom, Grant, who assigned himself as my personal bodyguard, and Ana, who acted as my lovely lesbian date for the Ball.

The Ball wasn't half as shiny as last year. 

That's all I'm gonna say about that.

Skipped off back to the hotel. Said 'hi' to Mum, who shipped in around seven and had been playing Flyff in her hotel room ever since.

Showered and then passed out with Erin.

End Day 1.


Day 2 in next post, for I am lazy and I am hungry, and Erin is willing to cook food for me.

Anyone who has spent more than a night with a very bored Heather lacking internet connection knows that Photoshop CS2 is the next best thing. 

Most recently, with more than a little blame placed on my scanner, it's been noted that I've run out of things to colour and or manipulate to my will. Except for pretty pretty doujin. 

I'm more than slightly amused and annoyed by the fact that I've got gorgeous art to colour, and despite the fact that I've drawn plenty that's almost as pretty, I can't, for the life of me, get my own to a scannable quality without it turning out 63% less pretty than my original. 

And, as a result, I've been colouring a hell of a lot of Idea's FMA doujin, as it's damn fine to look at, and similar enough to my own drawing style to give my ego a boost.

As as result of that result, I've got about ten banners/variations of banners that I desperately want to use as my header.

But that would require changing colour schemes and more messing around with CSS. Which I am far too lazy to do at this time.

WOE. 

I'll probably post them up sooner rather than later, but sooner will still be a bit of time.

Al is quite possibly the most fun to colour, and I have no idea why. =/

That bit of time is because of METROCON, which is this weekend. 

HUZZAH.

Then I'll be spending the next week at Erin's, watching Stargate at obscene hours and holding impromptu dance parties involving unhealthy amounts of Diet Coke, otherwise known as WIN in a can.

Indeed.

Well, I guess it's just me, then.

I randomly snagged this mask I picked up from like, seven years ago at some shiny, yet classy, tourist trap while on holiday, proceeded to mimic the design on the front with makeup-- on me, as I have no models on hand at one AM --, took several pictures of  myself and the mask, and proceeded to clean and edit them with CS2. And then post it up on deviantArt.

I can't quite decide if it's creepy or pretty yet. =/

...Also, feeling like I needed to post something up here, I dug through my old manip folder and snagged that Petlar pic below this entry-- which already had fireworks and colorwash attached from my 2007 Hawaii stock photos --and posted it up. 

Because I could.

Also because it's doubtful I'll ever manage more than one or two Petlar fics in the future, which means I don't have much of a reason to hoard my stash of banners. I might as well just post them up when I've got an occasion, right?

On a side note: smartphones are a pain in the ass. But I'll post more on that later, when I don't have laundry to shove in a bag for a roadtrip. DX

To those not, just enjoy the Petlar. =D

Moving on.

I'm officially doing movie!Al for Metrocon this year. Because movie!Ed was taken-- by a boy who actually has long blonde hair, believe it or not.

I still think he looks more like Hoho, though.

I was rather pissed when I found out. That's the second costume I can't do unless we want to be stuck with doubles-- Thanks to Krissy's friend, Nia apparently got snatched away from me too, even though I called it originally.

I may still make Nia's outfit as well, though. I already ordered a wig for it, so I figure I might as well.

...I think what bothers me the most about all this is that I can't bitch complain about it to these people in person. And by the time I can, once I arrive in FL, they're all going to be like, "Oh, it's too late anyhow. You should have said so eariler." or "You both could have gone as the same person!". And I mean, I could. But being compared sucks, and it's much more fun to have a full series group.

I kinda wish they'd tried to talk to me about the whole thing some more, too.

I mean, damnit, I know I'm not really a part of that whole FL-friend group. I get that. I'm just Erin's friend who shows up two or three times a year and hangs out with everyone. I'm the kid that can't remember anyone's names, is madly in love with Josh, and frequently gets lost in crowds. I don't get any of the inside jokes, and it's pretty obvious that I'm not really in that group. 

But would it really kill them to let me pretend?

So, I'm currently digging through my binder for the last quarter of school. 

Why? 

So I can light the papers I don't want on fire the moment this rain lets up. =D 

That being said, I uncovered an old quote: 


[While reading speech by Faulkner to the graduating class of University High School back in 1951.]

Trexluh has this habit of pretending we care: William Faulkner has a huge vocabulary.
Heather is the narrator and pwns you all: William Faulkner uses run-on sentences. I mean, there are only so many semicolons and commas you can use before it gets a bit excessive.
Miranda shall be henceforth known as Yamicus the Great: ...Look. That entire paragraph is one sentence.
Heather is the narrator and pwns you all: To be perfectly honest, I wasn't listening when we started this, so I didn't know it was a prompt. I thought it was supposed to be another one of those student things. ...I started adding periods.
Miranda shall be henceforth known as Yamicus the Great: You would.


Yeah. Faulkner, we were not amused.

My Chemistry grades are inversely proportional to my amount of doodling on supposed Chemistry notes. 

...I think that sentence is right. My math grade reflects how fantastic I was with proportions. Basically, NOT AT ALL.

Low and behold, I have fiction of a fandom nature. Have at it. Un-beta'd because none of my friends give a damn about the movie. D= 

Title: Legacy
Author: LilAngelHeather
Fandom: Fullmetal Alchemist
Ships: hinted Hei/Ed
Rating: PG-13 
Spoilers: If you haven't seen the movie, you'll have no idea what's going on. It fits in a bit after Ed pulls an Indiana Jones from that plane and the gate opens.
Word Count: 547

x-posted to 

blau_und_gold
  and
fma_fiction.

 

 

He's never been particularly selfish, all things considered.

It kills him, then, when he comes to the sickening realization that none of this was ever about him, or his rockets, or Germany-- it was all about Edward, and for more than a moment he hates the boy with every cell of his being before grudgingly acknowledging that Edward doesn't want it to be about him either.

But this was his legacy.

He's dying.

In the cosmic scale of things, it's not much, but damn it, it should've counted for something. Staring up at the giant glowing circle-- Alchemy, he thinks ruefully, who would have thought it? --and Edward, looking broken and distant way above his head, he really thinks it should've counted for something.

He keeps on thinking that until there's a sharp sound in the air, like a crack or a snap or a bang, and then there's Edward, falling from the sky and all he can think of is how Edward would always make references to Icarus, and how ironic and surreal this whole thing is.

And then he realizes Edward is falling.

He finds himself moving and is mildly surprised when he doesn't trip over some wiring left on the floor, thinking, Oh God, please, no, not Ed, not my Edward. Ed, nononononopleasedon'tbedead--

Alfons can't help but stare at Edward's body for a moment, calculating the boy's weight and the height of his fall, impact pressure and probability. He factors in the bang-- A gun, he's shocked to realize, --and promptly solves his equation. Edward is dead.

He notes a sudden sharp pain that slices up from his knees and all along his thighs before he figures out that his legs have given away. "No," he manages, but his breath is raspy, more than usual, and he can feel a liquid hiccup trying to push its way up his throat. His cheeks feel wet, and his hands start shaking.

And Edward has the fucking gall to move.

Bastard. 

Edward, God, I'd thought I'd-- You should be-- Ed, thankyouthankyouloveyougodEdwardmine--

Alfons clings to him for an eternity before he notices that Edward is still unconscious and he's practically choking the boy in a death grip. There's noise from the people above and some dull sound of marching feet, and Alfons struggles to lift Edward up and drag him to safety.

Blood bubbles out of his mouth on his next cough, and he thinks he might be a bit hysterical because he can't help but think that it's ironic to have the dead man save the one who should be dead.

The one-man rocket is the closest place, and Alfons is more than happy to stop dragging Ed around-- How much do those prosthetics weigh, anyway? He never did get the chance to take one apart, Edward was always so protective of them, --and dump him in the cockpit.

Something about wiping blood on blueprints seems sacrilege, but he doesn't want Edward to worry more when he wakes up. He should be allowed to be selfish about something, and a last moment with the man he loves seems just about right. He stands and starts to make the rocket ready to launch.

It's not about him.

But he'd be damned if he wasn't remembered as part of it.

So, our English class is getting a bit more talkative, believe it or not. 

What with my sudden lack of WHAP homework-- and Miranda's, too --and a decrease in everyone else's, we suddenly have a lot of free time.

A lot.

Hence the group doodles with the intelligent half of the Corner, along with an influx of inside jokes.

And guess what? 

The intelligent half-- They're being downright social with us. 

Terrifying. But amusing altogether. Sam can't quite seem to stop listening in on Miranda's little tirades and our-- increasingly louder and far more blunt as we've had discussions rather than pure lectures --commentary on the lessons, and David occasionally adds his own thoughts.

Today, we went back to gayness and it's probability in Pruflock. A little bit less enthusiastic this time, considering it was more of a joke than actual seriousness, and David wasn't wearing the purple shirt-- Not even attempting to be colourful for it, he was wearing grey. Wasn't remotely relevant, damnit. --but it was entertaining none the less.

We also decided that Pruflock's problems could easily be solved with porn.

...Indeed.

I'm not sure what that says about our class.

Amanda's gone back to writing-- Though it's not in scribbly English this time, she's now fond of Swedish, actually. --and Claire continues to bring food for Miranda and I to attempt to steal.

But ew, we're social.

WILL NOT END WELL.

So-- I spent this weekend doing a great deal of nothing, despite all of the work I need to do, for the simple reason that I did not want to think about it. 

Which pretty much sums up my life, right there.

Went to school-- HSA sched. this week, so all the kids were freaking out and running around trying to find their testing rooms. Apparently, today was Government. But the main point here is: the sched. is screwy. 

Had IR class for an extra hour, wasted most of my time doodling poorly-planned sketches which never really amounted to very much. The seniors all had to take the final, Eli's absent, and Brooks was taking the Gov HSA,so I pretty much sat there for a bit before deciding to snag some popcorn from the back room.

And by that, I mean the popcorn was delivered by the magical popcorn fairy, as a reward for my unwavering attention to the printer this year.

Yeah.

I <3 magical popcorn fairies. 

Went to English, and spent a great deal of time doing nothing... Again. Ate Miranda's animal-cracker Spanish knockoff cookies. Passed notes with Liz concerning distance relationships. Paid minor attention to the lecture. Was blinded by Miranda's hideously bright-red Turkish shirt of doom. Started the Great Doodle Experiment-- which stayed surprisingly on-topic with our class discussion --and it was passed around our entire side of the room this time. But mostly stayed with us.

Will post pictures later. Eventually.

Chem was sacrificed for the sake of the HSA, and I went on to Math, where I proceeded to distract Sarah until the bell rang and we were released to lunch.

Ta-da. 

That was today.

On a side note, Miranda and I decided that we could create the best musical in existance if we combined Rocky Horror with The Producers and Spamalot. 

Specifically the numbers 'Springtime for Hitler' and 'You Won't Succeed On Broadway If You Haven't Any Jews'-- with fishnet. 

As it is, we're already planning parodies for 'Springtime for Hitler' depending on who gets elected President.

Obama's version is by far the most humorous, though we admit that us moving to Canada might put a damper on the final product if he's elected. 

Hmm.

Today sucked.

Badly.

So badly, in fact, that the original post I wrote up to put for today DIED. 

Basically, I didn't have anything to do. So I pretty much spent today, sitting around, doing nothing. 

Which I really don't do-- I'm either sleeping, working, or procrastinating. 'Nothing' is a mildly annoying concept for me, because it means that I can't do something-- like sleeping, working, or procrastinating --and am stuck doing 'nothing' until something comes up.

Or I spontaneously kill someone out of spite. It varies.

I mean, I'd say I'm a workaholic, if not for the fact that I spend so much time trying to get out of working. Which is a contradiction in of itself.

...Yeah. 

That's my life. 

I have to figure out a couple of different things, so as of now, I'm using this as my to-do list. I need to figure out when I'm going to FL next-- And by next, I mean for the entire summer, so, Erin, start talking to the 'rents.

Life

Call Erin.

Schro Cosplay - accessories.
Ed Cosplay - find clothes to mod.
Ed Cosplay - make automail.
The Great Wig Debate.

Eat. (Ocassionally.)

Explode.
 
I'm missing several things, I'm sure. Gah. 

Anyway, that's basically my life for the next two weeks. If not less-- Some of that has to get done ASAP, and I'd rather have it out of the way sooner rather than later. Of course, my inner workaholic will be pushed over by my inner procrastinator about half-way through, and I'll be stuck in my usual panic. 

I guess it's nice to know some things never change?

All in all, pretty ordinary day.
 
Spent IR working on Math, then skipped off to English, where Trexluh proceeded to go over our thesis statements that less than half the class actually wrote. This would have been rather boring, if not for a question David posed at the start of the class; Who would win a fight, a moose or a walrus?
 
The answer is, quite obviously, the moose. I mean, tusks have nothing on those buggers.
 
Also, the moose has Latin Class sponsorship.
 
We love our mooses. Meeses. Miises?
 
Moosies. There we go.
 
Anyway, this was somehow translated into 'Who would win a fight, a moose, a walrus, or a narwhal?' by Claire and Miranda.
 
Moose still wins, but it brought up some interesting ideas in the Corner.
 
So naturally, they doodled a narwhal on the back of Miranda's test. Which I countered by doodling a moose, getting jumped by a narwhal. This paper was passed back and forth, until eventually, it found it's way out of the Corner and over to David and Sam, who doodled a dead walrus under the hooves of my moose.
 
And thus, it began.
 
The giant narwhal began to sell advertising space on it's tail, another moose appeared, riding on top of a smaller narwhal, and a sign was posted for 'Hitler-Stalin Funland', which was quickly followed by a showdown between Hitler and the moose mafia.

Yeah. All in all, very productive day.
